TextView.android:text: Throughout American history, racism towards black people has been extremely prevalent. Slavery, segregation, and the blatant mistreatment towards people of color has allowed generations of people to treat black people differently due to their deeply ingrained racist opinions about them. In 2013, the Black Lives Matter movement officially became an organization headed by public speaker Alicia Garza, freedom fighter Patrisse Cullors, and writer Opal Tometi. It was created in response to the acquittal of the shooter responsible for the murder of Trayvon Martin, a 17 year old African American boy who was wrongfully shot.

The Black Lives Matter movement is an ideological and political platform that highlights situations where black people are put to a disadvantage due to racism. This movement’s main focus has been centered around police brutality because it has heavily impacted the black community. By holding protests and demanding change, they were able to make their mark as a prominent organization that fights for equal treatment of black people. Since its inception, the BLM movement has inspired the creation of sister branches in eighteen different cities across the world.

In 2020, the Black Lives Matter movement has become the biggest civil rights movement till date with over 60 countries participating. After the tragic death of George Floyd, a black man that was wrongfully killed by police officer Derek Chauvin, many people felt that there finally needs to be permanent change. Mass protests have formed all over the country, not just because of this one event, but because of all of the injustice that black people have faced over 200+ years.

People are sick and tired of law enforcement getting away with murder and just mitreating black people in general. 98.7% of police officers that have wrongfully injured a black person were left uncharged afterwards, which demonstrates the corruption prevalent throughout law enforcement. Many campaigns have tried to get the police defunded but change has not come till now. Minneapolis and New York were the first states to change their programs and have a more public police record. Also, states such as Minnesota, California, and Maryland have begun to reallocate police money and essentially ‘defund’ them in order to help restructure the program and create other safety programs. The fight is not over yet, however, real reform is just around the corner if we all keep fighting.
